Sky sources understand that Arsenal have made a fresh enquiry for West Brom captain Jonny Evans as they look to bolster their defensive options, while the Gunners have also been linked with a move for midfielder William Carvalho, despite Sporting Lisbon's president insisting he's not for sale.

The Mirror reports that Arsenal will let Alexis Sanchez go this month if they can sign Riyad Mahrez. While Don Balon report that Lucas Vazquez from Real Madrid could be another option .

Up front Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang would get fans excited at the Emirates, despite Arsene Wenger saying signing the Borussia Dortmund striker is "not possible", and Arsenal are still one of the clubs keen on signing Thomas Lemar, according to the Express.

The Independent claim a move for Boca Juniors star Cristian Pavon is a possibility, while the Daily Star reports that Shakhtar Donetsk star Fred is also on Arsenal's radar.

Elsewhere, Julian Draxler of PSG remains a target according to the Daily Mail, as does Nabil Fekir of Lyon, according to the Metro.

Since his move to the PL in 2014, no player has been dispossessed more times than Alexis Sanchez (276). [WhoScored]

Balague: “At the moment, in terms of facts, Manchester United have not spoken to Arsenal. They have spoken to Alexis & the wages are higher than what City are offering Alexis.”

Guillem Balague on Arsenal: “If Alexis goes now, they are prepared. They’ve got a name, they’ve got a player that will replace him. They don’t have to negotiate anything with him, it’s just a matter of seeing if Alexis leaves now or at the end of the season.” [Sky]
